parameters: Doesn’t matter how old they are.\.\.
We found a body in one of the other rooms.\.\.
You’re all coming with us for a\fi very\fr long talk at the police station!\.\.
\fiEveryone else is stunned,\.\. gasping for answers.\.\.
She.\..\..\. she killed herself.\.\. We didn’t know what to do.\.\.
There was no one we could call.\.\.
\fiHe looks upset, or at least you assume he looks upset
\fiHe stares you down one by one.\.\.
Finally,\.\. the policeman’s eyes rest on you.\.\.
But you cannot be silent in the face of justice.\.\.\fr
Excuse me?\.\. Are you saying this was a murder?\.\.
\fiThe others are shocked.\.\. \C[28]Venus\C starts yelling at you.\.\.\fr
This isn’t one of your stupid detective games, \N[5]!\.\. This is real life!\.\.
You’re saying\. one of us is a murderer?\.\.
I know it’s not a game!\.\. \C[18]Kat\C\.\.—the victim\.\.
—she was my friend\.\.. And yes,\. she was murdered.
That’s a very serious claim, kid.\.\.
If you’re wrong,\.\. you could send an innocent person to jail.\.\.
You’d better have a lot of proof to back that up.\.\.
You can look at the body yourself.\.\.
How it could it be a suicide?\.\.
What do you mean?\.\. We haven’t had time to set up a crime scene.\.\.
CHANGED THE EVIDENCE TO variables SO THIS CAN WORK
value 2 is variable no kick-off stool
If she hung herself,\. then where’s the kick-off stool?\.\.
Kat was too short to hang her own noose.
There isn’t any sort of leverage in that closet.\.\.
No way she could have done it herself.\.\.
I think I know why \N[5] couldn’t find a murderer.\.\.
It’s because YOU’RE the murderer,\. isn’t it?\.\.
That’s right!\.\. You got all that evidence by snooping
in our rooms.\.\. You used your master key,\. didn’t you?\.\.
Probably the same master key \N[5] used when they broke
into Kat’s dorm and killed her.\.\.
You’re the only person who could cover up the crime.\..\..\.
I can’t believe you killed your friend.\..\..\.
Maybe you didn’t,\. kid,\. but taking photos of other
people’s rooms without their knowledge isn’t exactly
All of you are going in cuffs.\.\. We’ll sort the rest
of this out at the police station.\.\.
She wouldn’t.\.\. I know people who commit suicide often look
happy on the outside.\. But I know her. \.She just wouldn’t!\.
She was short,\. and would’ve had to climb to create the noose.\.\.
But there was nothing to climb or stand on in that closet.\.\.
She was looking forward to graduating.\. And I have so
much evidence!\. I have the pictures!\!
\fiYou show the police the photo of Kat’s closet.\fr
So\..\..\.. one of you is a murderer after all?\.\.
That’s it,\.\. you’re all coming in handcuffs on our ride back.\.\.
Wait!\.\. I know who did it too!\.\. I’ve been watching them.\.\.
If you look around or interrogate them,\.\.
you’ll be able to find all the evidence yourself too.\.\.
Alright,\.\. I’ll humor you.\.\. Who was it?\.\.
she can barely hide the guilt on her face.\.\.
What?!\.\. Why would I ever kill Kat?!\.\.
It’s Venus,\.\. she's not as carefree as she seems.\.\.
I \fiwas\fr carefree, asshole.\.\. God,\. you’re crazy.\.\.
It’s BB,\.\. the guy with the poor fake-crying skills.\.\.
Just because you can’t see under my glasses,\.
doesn’t mean you can’t see into my soul.\.\.
I think I know why \N[5] couldn’t find a murderer.\.\.
It’s because YOU’RE the murderer,\. isn’t it?\.\.
That’s right!\.\. You got all that evidence by snooping
in our rooms.\.\. You used your master key,\. didn’t you?\.\.
Probably the same master key \N[5] used when they broke
into Kat’s dorm and killed her.\.\.
You’re the only person who could cover up the crime.\..\..\.
I can’t believe you killed your friend.\..\..\.

All of you are going in cuffs.\.\. We’ll sort the rest
of this out at the police station.\.\.
I—\.\.let me show you my evidence!\.\. Then you’ll know!\.\.
.\..\..\.We’ll humor you until the rest of the squad shows up.\.\.
Then we’ll start a real investigation.\.\.
But after that,\. you are \fiall\fr coming with us.\.\.
Pointing fingers won’t get us anywhere.\.\.
So then,\.\. what about previous crimes?\.\.
Has anyone shown criminal behavior before?\.\.
23 is BB's Cease and Desist Letter
Jules. The bag of illegal pot in her room.
Venus. She got physically violent with Kat.
BB. He has a cease and desist order against an ex-girlfriend.
Jules. The bag of illegal pot in her room.
\fiYou show the police the picture of Jules’s baggie.\fr
Yes.\.\. Jules,\. you smoked pot illegally.\.\.
That baggie in your room.\..\.. I know it wasn’t from a legit
You even got arrested for it before.\.\.
That has nothing to do with Kat’s death.\.\.
That was an act of desperation.\..\..\.
I had nothing else to help my depression.\.\.
Street-grade marijuana is dangerous.\.\. You don’t know what
other substances might have been mixed in.\.\. Did you ever
hallucinate or blackout?\.\. Any unusual side-effects?
No!\. Well.\..\.. I don’t know.\. M-maybe some of it was
strange.\.\. But I would never hurt Kat under any influence!\.\.
Venus. She got physically violent with Kat.
Venus already hurt Kat once.\.\. They were in a fight,\.\.
but Venus was the only one willing to get physically
You’re saying she showed past violence towards the
No.\.\. It’s true.\.\. I saw it..\..\. She slapped Kat,\.\.

BB’s under a cease and desist order.\.\.

And he dated Kat too.\..\..\. Maybe it’s a pattern.\.\.
You’re lying.\.\. Where did you even get the idea to
make a fake letter?\.\. One of your movies?\.\.

All of you are going in cuffs.\.\. We’ll sort the rest

Not that I know of.\.\. But that doesn’t mean someone
here isn’t capable of killing another human being.\..\..\.
What about the day she died?\.\.
Did anyone see or come in contact with the victim?\.\.
Jules's "guilt" diary entry was dated the day Kat died.
Kat's body had splattered paint on it. Only Venus paints.
Torn pieces of Kat's clothing were in BB's room.
Jules's "guilt" diary entry was dated the day Kat died.
\fiYou show the police the photo of Jules’s diary.\fr
I don’t know if she saw Kat or not,\.\.
but…\.\. don’t you think it’s strange Jules would feel
so guilty on the day of Kat’s death?\.\.
Kat's body had splattered paint on it. Only Venus paints.
\fiYou show the police the photo of Kat’s body.\fr
There was fresh paint on Kat’s neck.\.\.
The only person with access to paint is Venus.\.\.
We went painting together,\. okay?\.\. She got some
on her neck when she rubbed it.\.\.
That doesn’t mean I killed her.\.\.
Torn pieces of Kat's clothing were in BB's room.
\fiYou show the police the photo of Kat’s torn clothes.\fr
I found some torn pieces of them in BB’s room.\.\.
Look,\. I’m not about to share mine and Kat’s sex life

Well,\. I saw her.\.\. We even made plans later in the
You mean the evening she died?\.\.
Wow,\. it’s not looking good for you.\.\.
When I got there,\. she was already dead.\.\. Earlier
she said she had other plans.\..\..\.
And your relationships with the victim?\.\.
How well did you all know her?\.\.
but some of us were closer than others.\..\..\.
Kat wrote out a clinic list for Jules
Kat wrote out a clinic list for Jules
\fiYou show the police the picture of Kat’s
Jules,\.\. Kat wrote this for you.\.\. She knew what
you were doing.\.\. She wanted to help you.\.\.
Maybe you took advantage of her trust.\.\.
That’s insane,\. N[5].\.\. She—\.\.she didn’t know
anything about me,\.\. and I guess I didn’t
Then why did you blame her for your arrest?
Then why did you blame her for your arrest?
Exactly.\.\. She knew exactly what you were doing
to yourself.\.\. I guess you never really got
over her betraying you,\. did you?\.\.
.\..\..\.Alright,\. I did blame her for what happened
to me.\.\. We \fiwere\fr close—\.\.and I felt like
she had betrayed me.\.\. But I got over it,\. I swear.\.\.
We were friends again.\.\. I wouldn’t go after revenge.\.\.
I would never want Kat dead.\..\..\.
I think she knew a lot more about you
I think you need to stop speaking for me \N[5].\.\.
\fiYou show the police the picture of Venus’s
Venus,\.\. you had Kat’s room key.\.\.
She clearly trusted you.\.\. And you had the means
to go into her room whenever you pleased.\..\..\.
Give it a rest.\.\. She gave that to me so I could
watch her dorm room when she was away.\.\. I just
forgot to give it back.\.\. We weren’t that close.\.\.
But you had a torn photo of you two.
But you had a torn photo of you two.
\fiYou show the police the photo of the torn photo.\fr
You two fought,\. didn’t you?\.\. The kind of bad fight
that only close friends could have.\.\.
So bad you were willing to mangle a photograph.\..\..
that came from Kat’s photo collection.\.\.
Fine.\.\. You’re right \N[5].\.\. We were close,\.\.
but she kept bugging me about how I was always failing.\.\.
It got on my nerves, and I ripped the photo.\.\.
But I tried to repair it, didn’t I?\.\. I felt sorry.\.\.
I repaired my relationship with Kat too.\.\.
I even dedicated a painting to her,\.
to show her how sorry I was.\.\.
BB knew her pretty well.\.\. In fact,\. I think the
whole dorm knew about their relationship.\.\.
Casual flings don’t mean anything nowadays.\.\.
I hardly knew her well enough to love her,\.
If you didn’t love her, why did she give you her necklace?
If you didn’t love her, why did she give you her necklace?
This was in your room, BB.\.\. Kat wouldn’t have just
She gave it to you,\. didn’t she?\.\.
but it’s clear she loved you\..\..\..
Wait,\. wait!\.\. I did love her.\.\. There,\. happy?\.\.
I loved her,\. and I wouldn’t kill her.\.\
I just didn’t want you to twist our relationship into
another one of your crazy theories.\.\.
That’s cold,\. even for you BB.\.\.
I can’t control someone else’s feelings dude.\.\.
I think I know why \N[5] couldn’t find a murderer.\.\.
It’s because YOU’RE the murderer,\. isn’t it?\.\.
That’s right!\.\. You got all that evidence by snooping

Yeah,\. and then she broke up with you.\.\.
All I’m saying is that \N[5] is pretty quick to point
\N[5] lied to us about the murder.\.\.
Yeah.\..\..\. You’re right.\.\. \N[5] did lie to us\..\..\..
It seems like you kids have more problems to
work out than just a murder.\.\.
Even if everything you’ve said is true,\.\. what’s the
motive?\.\. Why would your supposed suspect kill this girl?\.\.
Jules: protecting herself from abusive parents opinions on drug use
Venus: Kat found out she's failing.
BB: she wouldn’t marry him for his visa.
They all have reasons. I’m sure you’ll figure it out.
Jules: protecting herself from abusive parents opinions on drug use
\fiYou show the police the photo of Jules’s arrest report.\fr
No matter what she says,\. Jules can’t let go.\.\.
She held onto that arrest report because it reminded
her of what Kat did to her.\.\.
We know she’s willing to go to illegal lengths to solve
her problems,\.\. and she did it again this time.\.\.
She killed Kat because she couldn’t risk Kat telling
her parents about this.\.\. With so few people around,\.\.
you took your chance\..\..\.. and hung Kat in her own closet.\.\.
\N[5], no!\.\. I wouldn’t!\.\. Please!\. Kat was my friend!\.\.
The only person who\..\... who ever really cared for me…\.\.
Let’s finish this up at the police station and sort this
out for good.\..\..\. What a mess.\.\.
Venus: Kat found out she's failing.
\fiYou show the police the photo of Venus’s RTW notice.\fr
The reason you and Kat always fought is because of this,\.
isn’t it?\.\. She knew you were failing.\.\.
Maybe she threatened to tell someone you weren’t
supposed to be here anymore.\.\. But you wanted to stay.\.\.
I bet you wanted to live the fabled college life of
drinking and parties without ever having to do the real
work.\.\. But Kat would have ruined that for you.\.\.
I did want to stay here.\..\..\. But it’s because my friends
She was trying to help me get my life together,\.\.
and I didn’t see that until it was too late.\.\.
\fiShe points an accusing finger at you.\fr
And you.\..\..\. Trying to frame me for murder.\.\. Maybe
I ruined this degree,\.\. but you’re
I hope you’re proud of yourself.\.\.
Let’s finish this up at the police station and sort this
out for good.\..\..\. What a mess.\.\.
BB: she wouldn’t marry him for his visa.
\fiYou show the police the photo of BB’s visa notice.\fr
BB knew his visa was short on time.\.\. He was dating Kat—\.
a citizen already.\.\. It would have been so easy to just
But she didn’t want to marry you,\. did she?\.\.\. Deep down,\.
she knew what kind of person you were:\.\. selfish,\.\.
So you killed her for refusing after your visa ran out.\.\.
Hah!\.\. That’s a lot of guessing.\.\.
So what if my visa ended?\.\. I loved Kat.\.\.
We could have made long distance work.\.\.
But you didn’t love her,\. did you?\.\.
After her death,\. you immediately tried flirting with me.\.\.
You were only interested in who could get you a visa.\.\.
Kat must have found out…\. and then you killed her.\.\.
.\..\..\.You’re right \N[5].\.\. He tried to flirt with me too.\.\.
The day right after.\.\. I didn’t even think about it,\.
Kat always looked so uncertain around you BB.\..\..\.
She was going to break up with you,\. and you let your
anger get the best of you.\.\.
When he speaks,\. his voice is eerily calm.\fr
You’re right, \N[5].\.\. She didn’t want to marry me.\.\.
She found out about my past relationships too.\.\.
About some of the things I did.\.\. She was going to
tell the police.\.\. So,\. I killed her.\.\.
I carried her body to her room and hung her up so you
would all think it was a suicide.\.\.\.
I guess one of your crazy theories is finally true, \N[5].\.\.
\fiYou don’t say a word.\.\. You don’t want this theory
to be true,\. and yet.\..\..\.it is.\.\.\fr
That’s as clear a confession as can be.\.\. Lock him up.\.
We’re taking you down to the station to sort this out
